H0.text: in the honour of which god is anant chaturdashi celebrated. Vishnu

H1.text: in the honour of which god is anant chaturdashi celebrated. Krishna

H2.text: in the honour of which god is anant chaturdashi celebrated. Shiva

H3.text: in the honour of which god is anant chaturdashi celebrated. Ganesh

A4.text: Ananta Chaturdashi is a festival dedicated to Vishnu, observed and celebrated by Hindus.

A5.text: According to the Agni Purana, the Ananta (Shesha; the divine serpent) manifestation of Vishnu is venerated on this occasion to free adherents from sins.
